interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Grinding Away Skin Polishing Scrub, 3 fl. oz., Polishing Scrub Works to Improve Skin's Texture and Tone by Buffing Away Dead Skin Cells by Higher Education Skincare Review Date: 2020/08/03 Store: Higher Education Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Brand': 'Higher Education', 'Skin Type': 'All', 'Product Benefits': 'Smoother', 'Material Feature': 'Gluten Free, Cruelty Free', 'Number of Items': '1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '5.59 x 3.58 x 1.61 inches; 3 Ounces', 'UPC': '811381031008'} Review Text: I like that the particles are much finer than those in other facial scrubs. Other facial scrubs I've tried have coarser particles, so coarse it feels like I'm rubbing sand on my face.

What I don't like is that the product I received will expire in less than 3 months - Oct 2020. This doesn't seem to be just a one-time occurrence. I also purchased the "Higher Education MBA Night Renewing Serum with 0.5% retinol". That one expires even sooner - on Sep 2020.

I don't know what Amazon's policy is on expiration dates for skin care products. But, if I were purchasing this from a physical store, I wouldn't get something that expires in less than 3 months. I expect a product to be good for at least a year. Granted, expired doesn't automatically mean that a product is unusable. However, customers don't like getting old stock especially when a customer still has to pay full price for it. I didn't it but, if I were, I'd be annoyed enough to return the item.

I also don't know if Higher Education regularly sends soon-to-expire items to Amazon or if they're just doing this to Vine purchases. Either way, that's really not good practice. For a facial scrub that costs $25, I don't expect the seller to pass off expiring products on me.
UPDATE - After going through reviews of the two Higher Education products, it appears that they regularly send soon-to-expire products to customers. Bad seller - Higher Education. Really really bad.

One star for sending me an old product. Amazon, stop selling old products! Customers who paid full price for this - you should return the product. Review Title: expires in less than 3 months Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Higher Education Skincare: Goal Digger - Silky Moisturizing Cucumber Creme; formulated for dry and sensitive skin; cucumber extract; natural extract: melon, kale, cabbage, ginger, turmeric - 1.7 fl oz Higher Education {'Brand': 'Higher Education', 'Scent': 'Cucumber', 'Item Form': 'Creme', 'Unit Count': '1.7 Fl Oz', 'Number of Items': '1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '2.88 x 2.88 x 2.13 inches; 7.2 Ounces', 'UPC': '811381032050'} Nice green color with a refreshing cucumber scent. This feels light, not greasy and yet is very effective at moisturizing skin. It's quickly absorbed by my skin. I like that it doesn't have any AHA or retinol so that I can use this day or night in combination with different serums. light but very effective Grinding Away Skin Polishing Scrub, 3 fl. oz., Polishing Scrub Works to Improve Skin's Texture and Tone by Buffing Away Dead Skin Cells by Higher Education Skincare Higher Education {'Brand': 'Higher Education', 'Skin Type': 'All', 'Product Benefits': 'Smoother', 'Material Feature': 'Gluten Free, Cruelty Free', 'Number of Items': '1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '5.59 x 3.58 x 1.61 inches; 3 Ounces', 'UPC': '811381031008'} I like that the particles are much finer than those in other facial scrubs. profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Skincare Focus:** Prefers products for dry and sensitive skin, although recent interactions indicate an experimentation with exfoliators.
- **Texture Preference:** Enjoys lightweight, non-greasy formulas that absorb quickly, maintaining this preference even when trying new products.
- **Scent Preference:** Favorable towards refreshing, natural scents, specifically cucumber.
- **Ingredient Sensitivity:** Avoids products with active ingredients like AHA or retinol, indicating a preference for gentle, versatile options. Despite this, the user trialed a serum containing retinol, which reflects a potential willingness to explore products as long as they are well-tolerated.
- **Product Effectiveness:** Values high efficacy in moisturizing and skin improvement without irritation; however, dissatisfaction arose from receiving products with short shelf lives and potentially outdated stock.
- **Brand Affinity:** Generally holds a positive impression of brands but has expressed significant frustration towards one brand for poor inventory practices, especially regarding product freshness.

Overall, the user leans towards effective, gentle skincare solutions that enhance moisture without compromising skin sensitivity, while also being aware and critical of product quality and freshness. There is a noticeable reluctance to engage with brands that do not meet their expectations for product handling.
